intro: Borreria paranaensis, commonly known as the Parana borreria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Borreria paranaensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
